kannada:
ಊರೆಲ್ಲ ನೆಂಟರು | ಕೇರಿಯೆಲ್ಲವು ಬಳಗೆ |
ಧಾರಿಣಿಯಲ್ಲ ಕುಲದೈವನಾಗಿನ್ನು |
ಯಾರನ್ನು ಬಿಡಲೊ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Oorella nentaru | keriyellavu balage |
dhaariniyalla kuladaivanaaginnu |
yaarannu bidalo Sarvajna ||
translation: The whole village is my kin, and the entire street is my family; when the whole earth is the manifestation of the divine, whom can I possibly exclude, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ನಂದಿಯನು ಏರಿದನ | ಚಂದಿರನ ಸೂಡಿದನ |
ಕಂದನ ಬೇಡಿ ನಲಿದಾನು ನೆನೆವುತ್ತ |
ಮುಂದೆ ಹೇಳುವೆನು ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Nandiyanu eeridana | chandirana soodidana |
kandana beedi nalidaanu nenevutta |
munde heluvenu Sarvajna ||
translation: Meditating upon the one who rides the bull Nandi and wears the moon as an adornment—the one who rejoiced when asked for a child—I shall proceed with my recitations, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಅಂದು ಜೇಡರ ದಾಸ | ಹಿಂದೆ ನಾ ವರರುಚಿಯು |
ಇಂದು ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ನಾ ನಿಮ್ಮ ಕರುಣದ |
ಕಂದ ಕಾಣಯ್ಯ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Andu Jedara Daasa | hinde naa Vararuchiyu |
indu Sarvajna naa nimma karunada |
kanda kaanayya Sarvajna ||
translation: Once I was Jedara Dasimayya, before that I was Vararuchi; today, by your grace, I am Sarvajna, your own child, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಮುನ್ನ ಕೈಲಾಸದಲಿ ಪನ್ನಗಧರನಾಳು |
ಎನ್ನಯ ಪೆಸರು ಪುಷ್ಪದತ್ತನು ಎಂದು |
ಮನ್ನಿಪರು ದಯದಿ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Munna Kailasadali pannagadharanaalu |
ennaya pesaru Pushpadattanu endu |
manniparu dayadi Sarvajna ||
translation: Formerly in Kailasa, as an attendant to the one who wears the serpent (Shiva), my name was Pushpadatta; thus they recognize me with grace, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಅಂದಿನ ಪುಷ್ಪದತ್ತ ಬಂದ ವರರುಚಿಯಾಗಿ |
ಮುಂದವ ಸಾಲೆ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞನೆಂದೆನಿಸಿ |
ನಿಂದವನು ನಾನೆ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Andina Pushpadatta banda Vararuchiyaagi |
mundava saale Sarvajnanendenisi |
nindavanu naane Sarvajna ||
translation: The Pushpadatta of those days came as Vararuchi, and subsequently, having become known to the world as Sarvajna, that same person am I, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಮಕ್ಕಳಿಲ್ಲವೆಂದು ಅಕ್ಕಮಲ್ಲಮ್ಮನು |
ದುಕ್ಕವ ಬಸವರಸಗರುಪಲು ಕಾಸಿಯ |
ಮುಕ್ಕಣ್ಣನೊಲಿದ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Makkalillavendu Akkamallammanu |
dukkava Basavarasagarupalu Kaasiya |
Mukkannanolida Sarvajna ||
translation: When Akkamallamma expressed her grief of being childless to Basavarasa, the three-eyed Lord of Kashi was pleased and granted a boon, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಮಾಸೂರ ಬಸವರಸ ಕೂಸನೀಶನ ಕೇಳೆ |
ಕಾಶಿಯಾ ಅಭವನೊಳು ಪಡೆದ ವರವದು |
ಸೂಸಿತೆಂತೆನಲು ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Maasura Basavarasa koosaneeshana kele |
Kaashiyaa abhavanolu padeda varavadu |
soositentenalu Sarvajna ||
translation: When Basavarasa of Masuru prayed to the Lord for a child, the boon obtained from the Lord of Kashi manifested; I shall tell how it flowed forth, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಗಂಡಾಗಬೇಕೆಂದು ಪಿಂಡವನು ನುಂಗಲದು |
ರಂಡೆಮಾಳವ್ವೆಯೊಳು ಬರುವೆನೆಂದೆನಲು |
ಕಂಡದನು ಪೇಳ್ದೆ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Gandagabekendu pindavanu nungaladu |
randemaalavveyolu baruvenendenalu |
kandadanu pelde Sarvajna ||
translation: Desiring a son, he swallowed the consecrated offering; as for how I came to be born through the widow Malavve, I have spoken of what was witnessed, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಗಡಿಗೆ ಮಡಿಕೆಯಕೊಂಡು ಅಡಿಗೆಯಾವೇಳೆಯೊಳು |
ಬಿಡದೆ ಮಳೆಮೋಡ ಪೊಡೆಯಲು ಈರ್ವರಿಗೆ |
ತಡೆಬಿಡಲಾಯ್ತು ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Gadige madikeyakondu adigeyaveleyolu |
bidade malemooda podeyalu eervarige |
tadebidalaytu Sarvajna ||
translation: While busy with pots and pans at the time of cooking, as the rain clouds burst incessantly, the two were caught in a moment of sudden confusion, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಅಂಬಲೂರೋಳೆಸೆವ ಕುಂಬಾರಸಾಲೆಯಲಿ |
ಇಂಬಿನಾಕಳೆಮಾಳಿಯೊಳು ಬಸವರಸ- |
ನಿಂಬಿಟ್ಟನೆನ್ನ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Ambalooroleseva kumbaarasaaleyali |
imbinakalemaaliyolu basavarasa- |
nimbittanenna Sarvajna ||
translation: In the potter's street of Ambalur, within the graceful Mali, Basavarasa placed his seed; thus was I conceived, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಬಿಂದುವನು ಬಿಟ್ಟುಹೋದಂದು ಬಸಿರಾದಳವ- |
ಳೊಂದಾಗಿ ಹೊತ್ತ ದಶಮಾಸವುದರದಿ |
ನಿಂದಾನು ಬೆಳದೆ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Binduvanu bittuhoodandu basiraadalava- |
londaagi hotta dashamaasavudaradi |
nindaanu belade Sarvajna ||
translation: From the day the seed was left, she became pregnant; for ten months she carried me in her womb, and there I grew, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಹೆತ್ತವಳು ಮಾಳಿಯೆ | ನ್ನೂತ್ತಿ ತೆಗೆದವಳು ಬೆ- |
ನ್ನೊತ್ತಿ ಹಿಡಿದವಳು ಕಾಳಿಯು, ಮೊರದೊಳಗೆ |
ಬಿತ್ತರಿಸಿದವಳು ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Hettavalu Maaliye | nnotti tegedavalu be- |
nnotti hididavalu Kaaliyu, moradolage |
bittarisidavalu Sarvajna ||
translation: Mali was the mother who gave birth; Kali was the one who lifted me up and supported my back, and laid me out in the winnowing basket, O Sarvajna.
